data.title: Who owns Ferrari?
data.meta_description: FERRARI is a luxury sports car company synonymous with glamour and extravagance.But who owns the iconic company, and do they have any other car brands
data.text:
FERRARI is a luxury sports car company synonymous with glamour and extravagance.

But who owns the iconic company, and do they have any other car brands in their portfolio?

Who owns Ferrari?

Ferrari is arguably the biggest name in luxury car making.

The famous brand can trace its roots back to 1929 when Enzo Ferrari formed Scuderia Ferrari.

It has had many different owners over the years, including Fiat, but as of 2022, 67.09 per cent of the company is owned by the public.

Enzo's son Piero Ferrari retains 10 per cent and he other 22.91 per cent is owned by Exor, of which Ferrari S.p.A. is a subsidiary.

The Dutch holding company is controlled by the Agnelli family, a famous Italian business dynasty.

Ferrari is well-known for its cars such as the Roma, Superamerica, Testarossa and Enzo - named after its founder.

As well as creating a number of classic road cars that are the envy of petrolheads everywhere, the Maranello-based firm has also been extremely successful in Formula One.

Its team boasts the honour of being the only one to have completed every single season since the start of the world championship.

Some of the sport's most iconic drivers like Michael Schumacher and Niki Lauda raced for "the Prancing Horse", and they are the most decorated team in the history of F1.

Which other car makes does Exor own?

In addition to owning a 63.8% share in Serie A giants Juventus, Exor has other companies in the automotive sector.

And their investments aren't confined to the luxury market either.

Stellantis

Stellantis N.S. was formed in 2021 as part of a merger between Fiat Chrysler Automobiles and Peugeot S.A.

It was the world's fifth biggest automaker behind Toyota, Volkswagen, Hyundai, and General Motors for sales globally in the same year.

The firm designs, develops, builds and sells cars for numerous well-known brands, including:

Abarth

Alfa Romeo

Chrysler

CitroÃ«n

Dodge

DS Automobiles

Fiat

Jeep

Lancia

Maserati

Mopar

Opel

Peugeot

Ram Trucks

Vauxhall

Iveco

Industrial Vehicles Corporation, which goes by the acronym Iveco, is an Italian transport company headquartered in Amsterdam.

The company has production plants in China, Russia, Latin America and Europe and builds commercial vehicles like flatbed and box trucks.
